translation: (41) Śubha Heaven's Invitation to the Buddha for Purification Chapter 36

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時佛在舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時首陀會天，下閻浮提，至世尊所，請佛及僧，洗浴供養。
translation: It was then that the gods of the Śuddhâvāsa assembly descended from Jambudvīpa and went to the Bhagavān to invite the Buddha and his saṃgha to bathe and make offerings.

source_sentence: 世尊默然，已為許可。
translation: The Bhagavān was silent and gave permission.

source_sentence: 即設飲食，并辦洗具，溫室煖水，調和適體，蘇油浣草，皆悉備有。
translation: They then prepared food and drink, prepared washing implements, warmed the room with warm water, mixed the body with oil and coarse grass, and had everything available.

source_sentence: 施設已辦，白世尊曰：「食具已訖，唯聖知時。」
translation: After making the preparations, he said to the Bhagavān, "The food and drink have been prepared, but the sages will know when it's time."

source_sentence: 於是世尊及諸比丘，納受其供，盡共洗浴，并享飲食，其食甘美，世所希有。
translation: The Bhagavān and the monks then accepted their offerings, washed and bathed together, and enjoyed a meal that was delicious and unmatched in the world.

source_sentence: 食竟澡漱，各還本坐。
translation: When they had finished eating, they washed and rinsed, and returned to their original seats.

source_sentence: 是時阿難，長跪合掌，白世尊曰：「此天往昔作何功德，形體妙好，威相奇特，光明顯赫，如大寶山？
translation: Ānanda then knelt down and put his palms together as he said to the Bhagavān, "What did this god do in the past that made him have such a wonderful body, such a marvelous appearance, and such a brilliant radiance like a great mountain of treasures?

source_sentence: 唯願世尊！
translation: Venerable Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 敷演其事。」
translation: Explain its deeds."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「諦聽善持！
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Listen closely, O well-chosen one!

source_sentence: 吾當解說。
translation: "I will explain it.

source_sentence: 乃往過去，毘婆尸佛時，此天彼世，為貧家子，恒行傭作，以供身口。
translation: In the past, when Vipaśyin Buddha was born, there was a son of a poor family in this god or another world who used to work as a domestic servant to support himself and his mouth.

source_sentence: 聞毘婆尸佛說浴僧之德，情中欣然，思設供養，便勤作務，得少錢穀，用施洗具，并及飲食，請佛眾僧，而已盡奉。
translation: Hearing Vipaśyin Buddha's teaching about the virtues of bathing the saṃgha, he was delighted in his feelings, contemplated making offerings, and then worked diligently to obtain a little money and grain to use to give washing implements, food, and drink to invite the Buddha and the saṃgha to make all the offerings.

source_sentence: 由此福行，壽終之後，生首陀會天，有此光相。」
translation: Because of this meritorious act, when their life span ended, they were born in the Śuddhâvāsa Heaven and had this radiant appearance."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「而此天者，非但今日請佛及僧，尸棄佛時亦來世間，供養世尊及於眾僧，乃至迦葉佛時，亦復如是。」
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "That god not only invites the Buddha and the saṃgha today, but also comes to the world when Śrīgarbha comes to make offerings to the Bhagavān and the saṃgha, even up to the time of Kāśyapa Buddha."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「此天非但承供七佛，於當來世賢劫之中，興千佛出，亦當一一洗佛及僧，猶如今日無有差別。」
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "This heaven won't just accept offerings to seven buddhas; in the coming eons of goodness, a thousand buddhas will arise, and one by one they'll wash buddhas and saṃgha as if they were this day."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，因受天記：「於未來世，滿阿僧祇百劫之中，當得作佛，號曰淨身，十號具足，所化眾生，不可限量。」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān received the celestials' assurance, "In the future, for a hundred eons or more, they will become buddhas, be called Purebirth, and have their ten names fulfilled, and the sentient beings they will transform will be limitless."

source_sentence: 爾時阿難，及諸四眾，聞佛所說，歡喜無量，咸作是言：「如來出世，所利益大，如是少施，獲報彌多。」
translation: It was then that Ānanda and the four groups of people who heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced immeasurably and all said, "The Tathāgata's appearance in the world will be of great benefit, and such a small gift will have a great reward."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「善哉善哉！
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Good, good!

source_sentence: 如汝所言。」
translation: As you say."

source_sentence: 因為眾會，廣說妙法。
translation: Because of this congregation, they spoke the wonderful Dharma in detail.

source_sentence: 其聞法者，有得道迹、往來、不還、逮應真者，發大道意，各各歡喜，頂受奉行。
translation: Those who heard the teaching, those who had attained the steps of the path, those who had gone back and forth, those who had never returned, and those who had apprehended the truth, aroused the great intention of the path, rejoiced in each, and accepted and approved of it.

source_sentence: ◎（四二）善事太子入海品第三十七(丹本此品却在九卷為四十二)如是我聞：一時佛在羅閱祇耆闍崛山中，與大比丘僧，圍繞說法。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was in Mount Rājagṛha, surrounded by a large assembly of monks and nuns, expounding the Dharma.

source_sentence: 爾時賢者阿難，見提婆達多，於如來所，常懷嫉妬，驅飲醉象，推山鎮佛，種種方便，欲得危害。
translation: At the time, the good man Ānanda saw that Devadatta was always jealous of the Tathāgata, so he drove away a drunken elephant, pushed the mountain against the Buddha, and tried various tricks to harm him.

source_sentence: 然佛慈心，常有矜愍，於羅睺羅及提婆達多，視之一等無有差別。
translation: Nevertheless, the Buddha's compassionate mind was always kind, and he treated Rāhula and Devadatta equally, making no distinctions between them.

source_sentence: 賢者阿難，覩其如是，常懷怨恨，思惟在意，從座而起，偏袒右肩，長跪合掌，歎說是事。
translation: Seeing him like this, the good man Ānanda, always harboring resentment, considered his concern, got up from his seat, bared his right shoulder, knelt down with his palms together, and praised this incident.

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「提婆達多不但今日興惡於我，宿世之時亦傷害我，然我於彼常慈念之。」
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Devadatta not only does evil come from me today, but he also did harm to me in past lives, yet I'm always compassionate toward him."

source_sentence: 賢者阿難即白佛言：「不審宿世，提婆達多，亦為傷害，爾時慈愍，其事云何？
translation: Good man Ānanda then said to the Buddha, "I don't think it's true that in past lives Devadatta also did harm, but what was the matter with him at that time, when he was compassionate?

source_sentence: 願具說示。」
translation: Please explain it in detail."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「過去久遠，無數無量不可思議阿僧祇劫，此閻浮提，有一國王，名曰勒那跋彌，晉言寶鎧，領五百小國王，有五百夫人婇女，皆無有子。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Once upon a time in the distant past, in an incalculably long and unfathomably long incalculable eon, there was a king of this Jambudvīpa named Renal Bhāmi, known as the Jeweled Armor, who led 500 small kings with 500 wives and daughters, all of whom had no children.

source_sentence: 王便禱祠諸天日月山海樹神，經年歷紀，不獲子息。
translation: The king then prayed to the gods of the heavens, the sun, moon, mountains, and seas, but after years and years, he couldn't find a son.

source_sentence: 王大愁憂，而自念言：『我今無子，旦夕崩亡，國無紹繼，天下必亂。
translation: The king was greatly distressed and thought to himself, 'Now that I have no children, my country will collapse in the evening and have no successor, and the world will surely be in chaos.'

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: What's the reason?

source_sentence: 五百諸臣，不相賓伏，便當力諍，強弱相[夌*欠]，抂殺無辜，亡國喪民，莫不由此。』
translation: Five hundred ministers who aren't subdued by each other will then engage in a powerful dispute, and the strong and weak will [dawdle* owe] each other, killing each other without fault, and leaving their country and people dead, and none of them will be the result.'

source_sentence: 念是事已，益增憒惱。
translation: After thinking this, his worries increased.

source_sentence: 時有天神，知王至意，於王夢中，而語王言：『城外林中，有二仙士，其第一仙，身有金色，福德聰辯，不可逮及，汝苟須子，可往求請，必當迴意來生王家。』
translation: Then, a god who knew the king's intentions said to him in a dream, 'Outside the city, in the forest, there are two sages, the first of whom is golden in body and has unsurpassed fortitude and intelligence; if you need a son, go ask for him, and he will surely change his mind and come back to the king's family.'

source_sentence: 王尋驚悟，差有喜色，即勅駕乘，單將數人，遍至推覓，便得見之，即向求哀，種種自說，國無繼嗣，憂深慮重。
translation: The king was surprised and awakened, and he looked pleased. He ordered his carriage to send a few men alone to search for them, and they found them.

source_sentence: 『貪屈大仙，來生我家，紹繼國嗣，去我憂患。
translation: 'I hope that great sage Watts will come to my house and help us inherit the country and remove my grief.'

source_sentence: 若不見恥，唯垂見顧。』
translation: If you're not ashamed, just look at me.'

source_sentence: 爾時仙人，見王殷勤，不忍拒逆，即便可之。
translation: Seeing the king's earnestness, the sage couldn't bear to disobey him, so he accepted him.

source_sentence: 第二仙人，復語王言：『我亦當往生於王家。』
translation: The second sage then said to the king, 'I too will be reborn in the king's household.'

source_sentence: 王大歡喜，便辭還宮。
translation: The king was greatly delighted, and he returned to the palace.

source_sentence: 「經歷數時，金色仙人，即取命終。
translation: "After several hours, the golden recluse took his life and died.

source_sentence: 王大夫人，名曰蘇摩，即覺有娠。
translation: The king's wife, named Sumer, then realized she was pregnant.

source_sentence: 聰明女人，能得此智知所懷妊，分別男女，便自說言：『我所懷妊，必當是男。』
translation: A wise woman who has attained this knowledge knows when she's pregnant and discerns a man and a woman, and she says to herself, 'My pregnancy will surely be a boy.'

source_sentence: 王及宮內，聞此語已，欣悅無量。
translation: After the king and the palace heard this, they were delighted beyond measure.

source_sentence: 王勅宮內夫人婇女，盡共承給，稱悅其意，床褥飲食，極令細軟，將護進止，不臨危險。
translation: The king commanded the palace wives and daughters to support and please them, making their beds and food very soft and tender, and guarding their progress and staying out of harm's way.

source_sentence: 十月已滿，其大夫人，便生男兒，端正絕異，身紫金色，其髮紺青，人相具足，王及內外，觀之無厭。
translation: When the tenth month was up, his eldest wife gave birth to a boy, perfectly correct and unique, with a purple-gold body and violet-blue hair, and his human features were perfectly proportioned, which the king and his inner and outer servants never tired of observing.

source_sentence: 因召相師，令占相之。
translation: He summoned a fortune teller and asked him to divine his features.

source_sentence: 相師尋詣，上下觀相，歡喜踊躍，而白王言：『此兒相好，人中難有，聰明福德，不可逮及。』
translation: When the fortune teller found him, he looked him up and down, rejoiced, and jumped up and down, and told the king, 'This boy has good features that are hard to find among humans, and his intelligence and fortune are beyond compare.'

source_sentence: 王聞遂喜，復告相師，可為立字。
translation: The king was delighted when he heard that, and he again told the fortune teller that he could establish his name.

source_sentence: 相師問王：『今此太子，受胎已來，有何變異？』
translation: The fortune teller then asked the king, 'What has changed since this prince was conceived?'

source_sentence: 王即答言：『此太子母，索來妬惡，樂人之過，妄舉姦非，見他人善，心不為喜；懷妊已來，志性改異，為人慈仁，矜愚愛智，好修施惠，等意護養。』
translation: The king then answered, 'The prince's mother was vicious in her desire, delighted in the faults of others, deliberately committed adultery, and didn't rejoice when she saw the goodness of others; since becoming pregnant, she has changed her mind, become kind, prized foolishness and wisdom, cultivated goodness, and protected people with equal intentions.'

source_sentence: 相師聞此，讚言：『善哉！
translation: When the fortuneteller heard this, he praised him, saying, 'Good!

source_sentence: 此是兒志，寄情於母。』
translation: 'This is the intention of a child who puts his heart and soul into his mother.'

source_sentence: 便為立字，字迦良那伽梨，晉言善事。
translation: He then established the name Kālānagālī, which Jin says is a good deed.

source_sentence: 其第二夫人，名曰弗巴，第二仙人，亦復命終，生於第二夫人腹中，日月足滿，便生男兒，形體狀貌，無他殊異。
translation: When his second wife, named Pūrva, the second sage, also reached the end of his life, he was born in the second wife's womb, and when the sun and moon were full, he gave birth to a son whose form and shape were like no other.

source_sentence: 復召相師，而瞻相之。
translation: He summoned a fortune teller and asked him to look at his features.

source_sentence: 相師披觀，而語之言：『此太子者，是常人耳，福德智能，為足自任。』
translation: The fortune teller looked at him and said, 'This prince is an ordinary person of ordinary merit and intelligence, and he's fit to serve himself.'

source_sentence: 王復勅之，為其立字。
translation: The king then ordered him to establish his name.

source_sentence: 相師復言：『有何異事？』
translation: The fortune teller then said, 'What's different?'

source_sentence: 王語相師：『此太子母，索性忠良，為人慈順，樂宣人善；懷妊已來，返更樂惡，嫉妬賢能，見善不喜。』
translation: The king said to the fortune teller, 'The prince's mother was loyal and good-natured, kind and obedient, and happy to proclaim the goodness of others; after she became pregnant, she returned to enjoy evil, was jealous of goodness and abilities, and didn't like what she saw.'

source_sentence: 相師復言：『此亦兒志，寄之於母，故使然耳。』
translation: The fortuneteller then replied, 'This is also the wish of the child, which is attributable to his mother.'

source_sentence: 因即立字，為波婆伽梨，晉言惡事。
translation: He then created a word, 'Pāpakārin,' which he used to describe bad things.

source_sentence: 「其王爾時，注心愛念迦良那伽梨，不失其意，即勅為起三時之殿，冬時居溫殿，春秋居中殿，夏時居涼殿，安置伎樂，而娛樂之。
translation: "At the time, the king was so focused on remembering Kālānagālī that he didn't lose his mind and ordered that three seasonal halls be built, a warm hall in winter, a middle hall in spring and autumn, and a cool hall in summer, where music and plays were placed and entertained.

source_sentence: 太子漸大，聰辯殊異，學諸世典，十八部經，誦持通利，善其義理。
translation: The prince grew up, and his intelligence and eloquence were extraordinary. He studied the secular texts and the eighteen scriptures, reciting and upholding them with skill and skillfulness, and he became adept at their doctrine.

source_sentence: 後辭出遊，王即聽之，勅治道陌，除去不淨，乘大白象，金銀校餝，千乘萬騎，導從前後，街道陌中，一切人民，挾道兩邊，諸樓閣上，觀者無數，皆言太子：『熟似梵天，威相姿貌，人中希有。』
translation: When he later resigned and went on a journey, the king listened to him, ordered him to cleanse the roads of impurities, ride a great white elephant, a gold and silver beadle, and a thousand carts and ten thousand horses, guide them from front to back, and there were countless people on both sides of the road and in the mansions watching him, saying, 'He's ripe like a Brahma god, with a dignified appearance that's rare among people.'

source_sentence: 爾時太子，見諸乞兒，身體羸瘦，衣被弊壞，左捉破器，右持折杖，卑言求哀，從人乞匂。
translation: It was then that the prince saw these beggar boys, their bodies weak and thin, their clothing tattered, their left hand holding a broken implement, and their right hand holding a broken staff, all humble in speech and pleading, begging for a heater from the people.

source_sentence: 太子問曰：『何以乃爾？』
translation: The prince asked, 'Why is that?'

source_sentence: 群臣答言：『如此人輩，或無父母，孤窮單獨，無所依仰，癃疾狂病，不能作役，無一錢儲，身口所切，是使爾耳。』
translation: The ministers replied, 'Such a group of people might have no parents, be orphaned and alone, have no one to turn to, be sick and crazed, be unable to work, have no money saved, and have their bodies and mouths cut out for them. That's why.'

source_sentence: 太子慈愍，心深增悼。
translation: The prince was kind and compassionate, and his heart grew deep with sympathy.

source_sentence: 轉復前行，見諸屠兒，殺害畜生，稍割稱賣。
translation: As he resumed his journey, he saw butchers who killed animals and sold them by cutting them off.

source_sentence: 太子問言：『何以作此？』
translation: The prince asked, 'Why did you do that?'

source_sentence: 尋各答言：『我不必樂，祖父已來，以此為業，若捨此事，無以自濟。』
translation: Anāthapiṇḍika replied, 'I needn't be happy; my grandfather has been doing this for a long time, and if I let it go, I wouldn't be able to help myself.'

source_sentence: 太子聞此，長歎而去。
translation: Hearing this, the prince departed with a long sigh.

source_sentence: 轉前到田，見諸耕者，墾地蟲出，蝦蟇拾吞，復見有蛇，吞食蝦蟇，孔雀飛來，啄食其蛇。
translation: He turned forward into the fields and saw some plowmen plowing a field, a bug emerging from it, a frog picking it up and swallowing it, a snake devouring the frog, and a peacock flying up and pecking at the snake.

source_sentence: 太子問人：『此作何等？』
translation: The prince asked the people, 'What's this?'

source_sentence: 耕者答言：『此是我業，於中下種，後當得穀，以自供食，并輸王家。』
translation: The plowman answered, 'This is my business; I planted it in the middle, and later I will get grain to feed myself and give to the king's household.'

source_sentence: 太子歎曰：『人由飲食，殺害眾生，役身役力，辛苦乃爾。』
translation: The prince praised him, 'It's because of eating and drinking that people kill sentient beings and work themselves to death.

source_sentence: 轉復前行，見諸獵師，趣向群鳥，挽弓欲射，復見安網，張施在地，見諸禽獸，墮在其中，驚張鳴吼，不能得脫。
translation: Again, he went on ahead and saw hunters heading toward a group of birds, drawing bows and intending to shoot them, and then he saw a net spread out on the ground and saw animals and creatures caught in it that cried out in terror and couldn't be freed.

source_sentence: 太子問言：『皆作何等？』
translation: The prince asked, 'What did they do?'

source_sentence: 咸皆答言：『捕諸禽獸，以自供濟。』
translation: They all replied, 'Catch some animals to help themselves.'

source_sentence: 太子聞此，深歎捨去。
translation: When the prince heard this, he deeply regretted it and departed.

source_sentence: 到河池邊，見捕魚師，張網捕魚，狼藉在地，跳踉申縮，死者無數。
translation: When he got to the river bank, he saw fishermen opening their nets to catch fish, which were lying on the ground in a disorderly state, stumbling and shrinking, and numerous dead.

source_sentence: 太子復問，皆各答言：『我仰此魚，用供衣食。』
translation: When the prince asked again, they each replied, 'I look up to this fish for food and clothing.'

source_sentence: 太子長歎，愍哀群生。
translation: The prince gave a long sigh of pity for the sentient beings.

source_sentence: 『為衣食故，乃當如是，殺害眾生，供俟身口；殃罪日滋，後報如何？』
translation: 'For food and clothing, you must thus kill sentient beings to feed yourself and your mouth; what will be the consequences of that evil that grows with each passing day?'

source_sentence: 便迴還宮，憂念不樂，往白父王：『願賜一願。』
translation: He returned to the palace, became sad and unhappy, and went to his father, the king, and said, 'May I grant you one wish.'

source_sentence: 王答之曰：『恣汝所欲，不相違逆。』
translation: The king answered him, 'Do as you wish, and don't disobey it.'

source_sentence: 太子白王：『出行遊觀，覩彼群品，為衣食故，欺誑殺害，積罪日增，意甚悼愍，欲得供濟。
translation: The prince said to the king, 'I've traveled and watched them, and I've seen a group of people who deceive, murder, and accumulate more and more sins just for food and clothing.

source_sentence: 願王聽我，用於王藏，自恣布施，充民所乏。』
translation: May the king listen to me and use the king's treasury to generously give to the people for their lack.'

source_sentence: 王於太子，倍加愛念，聞其所語，不能違意，即便可之。
translation: The king was doubly fond of the prince, and when he heard what he said, he couldn't disagree with it, so he accepted it.

source_sentence: 「於是太子，即時宣下，告諸人民：『迦良那伽梨太子，布施窮困乏短之者，一切施給，皆悉來取，若有欲須金銀寶物衣服飲食及諸所須，當施與之。』

translation: The people coveted the treasure and took too much of it.

source_sentence: 太子還到，其船已滿，放船還來，船便沈沒，諸賈人輩，乍沈乍浮，太子已有如意珠，故身不沒溺。
translation: When the prince returned, his boat was full, so he let it go and returned, but it sank, and the merchants sank and floated, but the prince already had the wish-granting pearl, so he wasn't submerged.

source_sentence: 波婆伽梨遙喚太子：『當見救濟，勿便捐棄。』
translation: Pāpakārin called out to the prince from a distance, 'You must see help, don't abandon it.'

source_sentence: 太子聞語，即牽共浮，力勵相挽，便得出海。
translation: Hearing his words, the prince took them with him and floated with them, pulling them together with all his might, and then he was able to escape from the sea.

source_sentence: 出海之後，弟語兄言：『我曹兄弟，辭父母來，入於大海，望不空歸。
translation: After emerging from the sea, the younger brother said to his elder brother, 'We, the brothers, left our parents and came to enter the ocean, hoping not to return in vain.

source_sentence: 際遇不諧，喪失財寶，單身空到，甚可恥也。』
translation: It's a shame that we lost our treasures and arrived alone and empty because of an unfortunate encounter.'

source_sentence: 迦良那伽梨天性忠直，即語弟言：『我故得寶。』
translation: Being naturally loyal and straightforward, Kālānagālī said to his brother, 'I've therefore obtained the treasure.'

source_sentence: 弟語兄言：『當用見示。』
translation: The younger brother said to his elder brother, 'You will show it to him with your eyes.'

source_sentence: 即解衣裏以珠示之。
translation: He took off his robe and showed it to him with the pearl.

source_sentence: 弟得見珠，因而懷情，『念我父王恩慈不普，偏愛我兄，我不在意；今我二人，俱來入海，兄得異寶，我獨空歸。
translation: When he saw the pearl, the younger brother was overcome with emotion, saying, 'I'm mindful that my father's kindness wasn't universal and that he favored my brother, but I don't care; now, we've both come to sea, and my brother has obtained a different treasure, but I've returned alone to nothing.'

source_sentence: 從是已後，當賤遇我，我當云何？
translation: From now on, I'll meet him at a low price. What will I do?'

source_sentence: 因其臥寐，陰殺其兄，取其珠寶，歸語父王言，其兄沒海，於是乃當異愛念我。』
translation: As he lay sleeping, he secretly killed his brother, took his jewelry, and returned to his father, saying, 'My brother has disappeared into the ocean, so he will think of me differently.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，密自懷計，語其兄言：『人村漸近，我曹兄弟，不應俱眠，宜更坐守護持寶珠。』
translation: After he thought this, he secretly planned it for himself and told his brother, 'As the people's village approaches, we brothers shouldn't sleep together; we should sit up again and guard the precious jewels.'

source_sentence: 兄即然之，常共更守。
translation: The brother then agreed, and they always guarded it together.

source_sentence: 波婆伽梨，次應休眠，臥地經時，極過常度，然後乃起。
translation: Prabhākaramitra then took a nap and lay on the ground for a while longer than usual before rising.

source_sentence: 兄復次臥，由坐久故，睡寐極著。
translation: He then lay down again, and because he had been sitting there for a long time, he became very deep in sleep.

source_sentence: 波婆伽梨，起入林中，林中有樹，其刺極利，即取兩枚，各長尺五，持來兄邊，兄眠甚重，一手捉刺，當其眼宕，刺令沒刺，收寶而去。
translation: He then took two thorns, each about five feet long, and brought them to his brother's side. He was sleeping heavily, so he grabbed the thorns with one hand, put them between his eyes, stabbed them until they disappeared, collected the treasure, and left.

source_sentence: 太子苦痛，高聲急喚：『波婆伽梨！
translation: The prince was distressed and called out loudly and urgently, 'Pāpakārin!'

source_sentence: 波婆伽梨！
translation: Pāpakārin!

source_sentence: 此中有賊。』
translation: 'There's a thief in there.'

source_sentence: 喚經數返無有應者。
translation: He called out to them several times, but there was no answer.

source_sentence: 「爾時樹神語太子言：『波婆伽梨，是汝之賊，刺汝眼竟，持汝珠去。』
translation: "It was then that the tree god said to the prince, 'Bāvākara, this is your thief! After piercing your eyes, he took your pearl and left.'

source_sentence: 於是太子宛轉辛苦，匍匐而行，漸小前進，到梨師䟦陀國。
translation: The prince then took pains to prostrate himself and gradually advanced little by little to the country of Lhishta-putra.

source_sentence: 至於澤宕，值五百頭牛來到其邊，有一牛王，見於太子，憐敬兼懷，出舌舐之，餘牛悉集，愕住共視。
translation: When he reached Zhetang, he met 500 cows that had arrived at his side, and there was a king of cows who, when he saw the prince, showed him both pity and respect and licked his tongue, causing the other cows to gather and look at him with dismay.

source_sentence: 時牧牛人，來前試看，乃覩太子臥在于地，見其眼中，有是長刺，觀其形相，又知非凡，即為拔刺，將至住處，常以酥乳，著其瘡中，飲食供給，隨其瞻養。
translation: When the cowherd came to examine him, he saw the prince lying on the ground and saw that he had this long thorn in his eye.

source_sentence: 復經數時，眼瘡漸差，主人承事，未曾懈廢。
translation: After several more years, the sores gradually healed, and his master took care of him without ever neglecting to do so.

source_sentence: 爾時太子，問牧牛人：『汝居此中，有何基業？』
translation: It was then that the prince asked the cowherd, 'What's your foundation for living here?'

source_sentence: 牧牛人答：『我在此中，無有基業，唯仰乳酪，賣用自濟。』
translation: The cowherd replied, 'Here, I have no foundation but milk and cheese, which I sell to help myself.'

source_sentence: 太子自念：『我遭困厄，勞煩主人，恒供養我。
translation: The prince thought to himself, 'I've been troubled and troubled, and I've had to trouble my master to provide for me.

source_sentence: 今者瘡差，小能行來，當更方宜求易處所。』
translation: Now, with my sores and difficulties, I'm not able to travel much, so I'll try to find another place that's easy to get to.'

source_sentence: 念是事已，因語主人：『爾所時節，共相勞煩，感念主人，恩難酬報。
translation: After he thought about this, he said to his master, 'I've been troubled by this time and trouble together, and I'm grateful to my master for his kindness, which is hard to repay.

source_sentence: 我欲前行，到於城中，展轉行乞，以自供活。』
translation: I want to go ahead and go to the city and beg repeatedly to provide for myself.'

source_sentence: 時牧牛舍主，聞太子言，懼其舍內妻子奴婢有餘厭辭聞太子耳，『若其不爾，何緣乃辭？』
translation: When the owner of the cowherd's quarters heard what the prince said, he was afraid that his wife and children might be tired of hearing about it, 'If that's not the case, why did he say goodbye?'

source_sentence: 作是念已，先問舍內：『汝曹有何不稱之事，而令貴客辭欲索去？』
translation: After this thought, he first asked Śākya, 'Is there something you know that's not worthy of mention that caused your valued guest to resign and ask for it?'

source_sentence: 舍內皆言：『我曹於此如兄如弟，不知何緣欲相捨去？』
translation: Everyone in the monastery said, 'We are like brothers to him; for what reason do we want to leave him?'

source_sentence: 於時舍主，語太子言：『我相承侍，未有不稱，不可捨我轉行餘乞。』
translation: The householder then said to the prince, 'I've served him well, and there's nothing he doesn't approve of; don't abandon me and go to another beggar.'

source_sentence: 於時太子，聞舍主語，見其慇懃，恒護其意，且小停住。
translation: Then, when the prince heard what the householder said, he saw his courtesy and continued to protect his wishes, and he made a small stop.

source_sentence: 復經數時，便語主人：『汝供待我，隨時無乏，家內一切，接我隆厚。
translation: After a few more moments, he then said to his master, 'Your offerings to me have never been lacking at any time, and everything in your home has been generous to me.

source_sentence: 但我意中，自欲轉行到前城中，望遣一人，將我共往。』
translation: However, my intention is to travel to the city before me, so I hope you'll send someone to take me there with you.'

source_sentence: 時牧牛人，見其慇懃，恐違其意令其心愁，躬自將護，共至城中。
translation: Seeing his solicitude, the cowherd feared he might disobey him and cause him distress, so he took care of him and escorted him to the city.

source_sentence: 已到彼城，共別當還，太子語言：『汝哀我者，買索一琴，與我自娛。』
translation: When they arrived in that city and were about to return together, the prince said, 'Sir, I'm sorry, but buy a lute and give it to me for my own enjoyment.'

source_sentence: 時牧牛人，尋買索與，共相辭謝，於時別去。
translation: The cowherd then found a lute to buy and give to him, and they both thanked him and departed.

source_sentence: 「爾時太子，素多伎能，歌頌文辭，極善巧妙，即於陌宕，激聲歌頌，彈琴以和，音甚清雅，城中人民，聞其音者皆樂聽觀，無有厭足，各持飲食，競來與之。
translation: "At the time, the prince, who had long been skilled in singing and speaking, was very clever at singing and playing his lute in harmony with the sound, which was so elegant that the people of the city who heard its sound were delighted to listen and watch, and they didn't tire of it.

source_sentence: 時城中有五百乞兒，皆來依附，賴其飽食。
translation: There were then five hundred beggars in the city, all of whom came to rely on him for food and drink.

source_sentence: 梨師䟦王，有一園監，為王監守果[木*奈]之園。
translation: King Rishiṣṭha had a park superintendent who guarded the fruit [muktagna] garden for the king.

source_sentence: [木*奈]有熟者，鸚鵡來食，手力不周，不能驚遮。
translation: When a [muk*nai] ripened, a parrot came to eat it, but its hand wasn't strong enough to scare it away.

source_sentence: 於時園監，檐[木*奈]與王，其中好[木*奈]，鸚鵡啄壞，王見瞋恚，欲加刑罰。
translation: The garden supervisor then eaves [mok*nae] to the king, where the good [mok*nae] is pecked and damaged by the parrot.

source_sentence: 園監惶怖，向王自陳：『家乏人力故使爾耳，唯見寬恕，原匂刑罰，當索守人，更不令爾。』
translation: The supervisor was terrified and told the king, 'It's because our family lacks manpower that we did it.

source_sentence: 王便恕置，不問其罪。
translation: The king then forgave him and didn't question him about his crime.

source_sentence: 園監得脫，行求索人，見迦良那伽梨，匂於道邊，觀其形相，似是忠人，即語之曰：『汝能為我看守園不？
translation: When he was freed, the supervisor went out to search for someone, and he saw Kālānagālī, a heater by the road, whose appearance appeared to be that of a faithful man, and told him, 'Will you guard the garden for me?'

source_sentence: 汝若能者，當供所乏。』
translation: If you can, you'll provide for what's lacking.'

source_sentence: 太子答言：『我眼無見，云何看守？』
translation: The prince answered, 'How can I guard it when my eyes don't see it?'

source_sentence: 園監語言：『汝苟欲看，雖復無眼，當作方便，多作細繩，繫諸樹端，以諸鈴物，連繫相著，展轉相牽汝捉一頭；若聞有聲，汝便頓繩，鸚鵡驚怖無緣得住。』
translation: The gardener said to him, 'If you want to look, even though you don't have eyes, you should make a lot of thin ropes, tie them to the ends of trees, and attach them to bells, tying them together and pulling them from one end to the other; if you hear a sound, you can snap the rope, and the parrot will be frightened and have no reason to stay.'

source_sentence: 太子聞語，而答之言：『若有此事，我能為之。』
translation: When he heard this, the prince answered, 'If there's anything I can do, I can do it.'

source_sentence: 共相可竟，即往為守。
translation: After they had both agreed, they went to guard the place.

source_sentence: 「時波婆伽梨，到父王國，王怪獨來，即問消息。
translation: "When Pāpakārī arrived in his father's kingdom, the king wondered why he had come alone and asked for news.

source_sentence: 波婆伽梨，而語王言：『我曹不遇，船重沈沒，迦良那伽梨并諸賈人，合諸珍寶，盡沒大海。
translation: He said to the king, 'I didn't meet him, and my ship sank, and Kālānagālī and the rich people and treasures that I had gathered there sank into the ocean.

source_sentence: 我力勵浮，趣得全濟。』
translation: I'll try to buoy them up and get them all back.'

source_sentence: 王及夫人，聞是語已，悶絕良久，無所覺識，以水灑面，困乃還穌。
translation: After hearing those words, the king and his wife were despondent for a long time, lost consciousness, and returned to their senses after being sprinkled with water.

source_sentence: 宮閤內外諸王臣民，聞此事者，莫不悲悼。
translation: When the king's subjects inside and outside the palace heard about this, they all mourned.

source_sentence: 王及夫人，語波婆伽梨：『迦梨太子沒海，汝何以來？
translation: The king and his wife said to Pāpakārī, 'Where did you come from when Prince Kālī disappeared into the ocean?'

source_sentence: 何不并就死大海中？』
translation: Why don't we just die in the ocean?'

source_sentence: 合土人民，無不痛惜，朝夕哭戀，如喪父母。
translation: The people of the combined lands were all saddened, and they wept and lamented night and day as if they had lost their parents.

source_sentence: 太子在宮，常愛一鴈，王告其鴈：『太子養汝，今入大海，奄沒不還，何不往看，知其所在？』
translation: When the prince was at the palace, he always loved a wild animal. The king told the animal, 'The prince raised you, but now you've fallen into the ocean and are dying and won't return; why don't you go look at it and find out where it is?'

source_sentence: 因作書音，以繫鴈項。
translation: He then wrote a musical score and tied it to the neck of a wild animal.

source_sentence: 鴈即高翔，廣行求覓，遊彼園上，識其歌聲，即下試看，得見太子，鳴聲悲喜，不能自勝。
translation: The male then took flight, traveled far and wide in search of it, wandered up to the park, recognized its song, and went down to examine it. When he saw the prince, he was overcome with joy and happiness at its cry.

source_sentence: 太子聞識，即解取書，眼無所見不能看讀，因求紙筆作書與王，說波婆伽梨刺眼委曲，所更歷處，辛酸諸事。
translation: When the prince heard and realized it, he took the book, but he couldn't read it because his eyes didn't see anything. He asked for a pen and paper to write a book for the king, telling him about the harshness of Pāpakārī's eyes and the painful places he'd experienced.

source_sentence: 繫於鴈項，鴈便飛去。
translation: He tied it to the neck of an antelope, and it flew away.

source_sentence: 「梨師䟦王，時有一女，端政殊妙，世間希有，王甚愛重，不違其意。
translation: "Then there was a woman, King Rishiṣṭha, of marvelous qualities and rare in the world, whom the king loved and respected, and she didn't disobey him.

source_sentence: 時女辭王，出遊園觀，王便聽去。
translation: The woman left the king and went out to look around the garden, but the king listened.

source_sentence: 女至園中，見於太子迦良那伽梨，頭亂面垢，目無所見，著弊壞衣，坐林樹間。
translation: When she arrived at the park, she saw Kālānagālī, a crown prince, with his head in disarray, his face dirty, his eyes invisible, and wearing tattered clothing, sitting among the trees.

source_sentence: 其女觀察，覩其色狀，心情屬向，不離其側，便坐其邊，與共談語。
translation: She looked at him, saw his appearance, and his mood was mutual, so she sat down beside him and talked with him.

source_sentence: 食時已到，王遣人喚，女還遣人白於王曰：『願送食來，欲就此食。』
translation: When the time for food arrived, the king sent someone to summon her, and the woman sent someone back to the king to tell him, 'May I bring you some food? I'd like to eat here.'

source_sentence: 即送食來，女語太子：『我欲共汝一處坐食。』
translation: She then sent the food, and she said to the prince, 'I'd like to sit with you in the same place and eat.'

source_sentence: 太子答言：『我是乞匂之人，汝是王女，云何共食？
translation: The prince answered, 'I'm a beggar for food, and you're the king's daughter; how can we eat together?'

source_sentence: 王若聞者，罪我不少。』
translation: If the king hears this, I won't be sinned against much.'

source_sentence: 其女慇懃，語太子言：『若汝不肯，我便不食。』
translation: She was so kind, she said to the prince, 'If you won't do it, I won't eat.'

source_sentence: 如是數返，逼迫不已，而便共食。
translation: She returned several times like this, pressed no further, and then shared her meal.

source_sentence: 言遂欵篤，意漸附近，目無去離。
translation: They then spoke sincerely, gradually drew near to each other, and didn't let their eyes depart.

source_sentence: 日轉欲暮，王遣人喚女，女還遣人往白王曰：『我願為此守園人婦，不用其餘國王太子，今我專心，慇懃如是。
translation: As the sun was approaching twilight, the king sent for the girl, and she sent someone else to the king to tell him, 'I would like to be this woman who guards the garden, not the prince of another king, but now I'm focused and attentive like this.

source_sentence: 唯願父王！
translation: May it be so, Father!

source_sentence: 勿違我意。』
translation: Don't go against my wishes.'

source_sentence: 使到王所，具噵其事。
translation: The messenger went to the king and told him everything about it.

source_sentence: 王聞是已，不能違情，因自言曰：『此事災異，是女不肖。
translation: After hearing this, the king couldn't disagree with him. He therefore said to himself, 'This is a disastrous situation, and the woman is unworthy.

source_sentence: 乃至若是，寶鎧大王，為第一太子迦良那伽梨，來求索之。
translation: Even so, the great king with the jeweled armor came to ask for Kālānagālī, the first prince.

source_sentence: 今此太子，入海未還，乃欲為是乞兒作婦，辱人名字，甚為不少。
translation: Now, this prince, who has yet to return from the sea, wants to be a wife for this beggar, and he insults people's names, which is quite a lot.

source_sentence: 我當覆頭藏著何處？』
translation: Where will I cover my head and hide it?'

source_sentence: 作是語已，復遣人喚；女言如初，執志不移。
translation: After he said this, he sent another man to summon her, and she said as before that she was determined not to change her mind.

source_sentence: 時王愛念，不能違意，就并將來，著於宮中，便令交會成為夫婦。
translation: The king then loved her and couldn't disobey her, so he took her, put her in the palace, and made her meet as husband and wife.

source_sentence: 復經數日，婦恒晝去，冥乃來還，夫怪問之：『汝言與我共為夫婦，晨去暮還，心不在此，將為他志故使爾耶？』
translation: After several more days, the woman continued to leave by day and returned after dark. The husband asked her, 'Did you say you'd be husband and wife with me and return in the morning when you left and returned at night, but your mind wasn't here?

source_sentence: 婦因自誓：『我今一心，共相尊奉，無有他意大如毛髮。
translation: The woman then vowed to herself, 'Now, with one mind, we'll honor each other, and there'll be no other wish as big as a hair.

source_sentence: 若當實爾，至誠不虛，令汝一目平完如故。』
translation: If this is true, with utmost sincerity and nothing but the truth, I will make your one eye look even and complete as before.'

source_sentence: 言誓已訖，一目尋復如故。
translation: After he finished saying his vow, his one eye looked exactly as it had before.

source_sentence: 復問太子：『汝之父母，為在何國？』
translation: He then asked the prince, 'Which country are your parents in?'

source_sentence: 太子語婦：『汝聞大王勒那跋彌名字不耶？』
translation: The prince said to the woman, 'Have you heard the name of Maharāja Renunciant?'

source_sentence: 答言：『聞之。』
translation: He replied, 'I've heard of it.'

source_sentence: 『是我父也。
translation: 'That's my father, too.

source_sentence: 彼王太子迦良那伽梨，汝復聞不？』
translation: Did you hear of Kālānagālī, the king's prince?'

source_sentence: 答言：『聞之。』
translation: He replied, 'I've heard of it.'

source_sentence: 『我身是也。』
translation: 'My body is this.'

source_sentence: 婦即驚問：『汝復何為辛苦如是？』
translation: The woman was then startled and asked, 'Why did you work so hard?'

source_sentence: 太子因為說其本末。
translation: The prince then explained the source and the derivative.

source_sentence: 婦聞是語，深懷歎息，語太子言：『波婆伽梨，懷害於汝，自古至今，未有此處。
translation: When the woman heard this, she was deeply moved and said to the prince, 'There's no place since ancient times that has been harmful to you, Popakārī.

source_sentence: 汝若得彼，當云何治？』
translation: If you were to get them, how would you treat them?'

source_sentence: 答言：『波婆伽梨雖害於我，我於其邊，永無瞋恨。』
translation: She replied, 'Even though Pāpakārī harmed me, I'll never hate him for it.'

source_sentence: 婦復語言：『此事難信，相困如是，奈何不瞋？』
translation: The woman then said, 'This is hard to believe; how could I not be angry when I'm so trapped?'

source_sentence: 迦良那伽梨因自誓言：『若我於彼波婆伽梨，無有微恨大如毛髮，我言至誠，不虛欺者，當令一目復得平復。』

translation: Sixth, he's sitting on the king's royal throne, his majestic features lofty, and he's sitting quietly.

source_sentence: 七者諸王群臣，歡喜敬禮，稱善無量，入於後宮，夫人婇女，踊躍歡喜，作禮恭敬。
translation: Seven: The king's ministers rejoice and venerate him, praising him as good and immeasurable, and when they enter the rear palace, the ladies and women dance with joy and rejoice, paying homage and respect.

source_sentence: 八者若將至於天祠，泥天木像，悉為作禮。
translation: Eight, if he were to go to a celestial shrine, he'd be honored with a wooden image of a clay god.

source_sentence: 九者福德威力，能雨七寶，稱給一切。
translation: Nine, his merit and might are so great that he's able to rain down seven treasures and praise them to all of them.

source_sentence: 十者其母是誰，提婆跋提夫人所生。
translation: Ten, whose mother was born to Lady Devapati?

source_sentence: 若有具足是十功德，斯乃立之，用作大王。』
translation: If someone possesses these ten virtues, then they'll be created and used as a great king.'

source_sentence: 教勅已竟，無常對至，遂便命終。
translation: After he finished his instructions, impermanence confronted him, and he was killed.

source_sentence: 「諸王臣民，五百子中，從其大者，次以十事，觀相其身。
translation: "Among the king's subjects, he chose the eldest of the 500 sons and observed his body in terms of the ten qualities.

source_sentence: 此諸太子，身無金色，髮無紺青，手掌無輪，足底無有象馬之相；著王者服不相應當；坐于御座，其木師子，驚張起立，欲搏嚙之；諸王臣民，悉不敬禮；將至宮內，夫人婇女，悉不歡喜，無禮敬者；設入天祠，自禮天像，諸餘泥木天像，悉不作禮；語使雨寶，亦復不能；又復不是提婆跋提夫人所生。
translation: These princes had bodies that were not gold, hair that was not purple and blue, palms that had no wheels, and soles that did not have the shape of an elephant or horse; they wore robes that didn't match the king's; they sat on the royal throne, but their wooden lion rose up in surprise and wanted to bite them; none of the king's subjects paid respect to them; when they arrived at the palace, none of the ladies or women were happy or paid respect to them; they went into the celestial shrine and paid homage to their own images, but none of the other images of the clay gods paid homage; they were unable to send rain or treasure, and they were not born to Lady Devapati.

source_sentence: 乃至五百諸大太子，於十事中，乃無一事。
translation: Of the five hundred great princes, there's not a single one among the ten things he does.

source_sentence: 最下小子，身紫金色，其髮紺青，看其兩手，輪相具足，覩其脚底，象形馬相，昞然如畫；著王法服，與身相可；坐於御座，福德巍巍；諸王臣民，無不敬禮；入於後宮，夫人婇女，敬奉作禮；將至天祠，泥木天像，悉皆為禮；教使雨寶，始語即雨；問是誰生？
translation: The youngest has a purple-gold body and deep blue hair, and when he looks at his hands, they have perfectly proportioned wheels, and when he sees the soles of his feet, the elephant-shaped horses look like pictures; he's dressed in the king's robes, which match his body; he's sitting on the royal throne, his fortune is lofty; all the king's subjects revere him; when he enters the rear palace, the ladies and women there respect and venerate him; when he approaches the celestial shrine, the clay images of the gods all venerate him; when he asks for rain, the first thing he says is, "Who was born?

source_sentence: 提婆跋提夫人所生。
translation: He was born to the wife Devabhadra.

source_sentence: 十事具足，諸王臣民，即拜為王。
translation: When the ten conditions were fulfilled, the king's subjects worshipped him as king.

source_sentence: 至十五日，日初出時，有金輪寶，從東方來，輪有千輻，縱廣一由旬。
translation: On the fifteenth day, when the sun first rose, there appeared a golden wheel-treasure from the east with a thousand spokes and a length of a yojana.

source_sentence: 王即下座，右膝著地，跪而言曰：『若我福德，應為王者，輪當稱我。』
translation: The king then got down from his seat, knelt on his right knee, and prostrated himself, saying, 'If I were so virtuous that I should be king, the wheel would be called mine.'

source_sentence: 即如其言，來在殿前，住虛空中。
translation: According to his words, he came and stayed in the sky in front of the palace.

source_sentence: 白象寶者，從香山來，毛尾貫珠，若王乘上，象皆能飛，從朝至午，徧四天下，若以足行，足所觸地，即成金沙。
translation: The white elephant treasure comes from Gandhāra with a pearl in its hair and tail, and if the king rides on it, the elephant is capable of flying, and from morning until noon, it spreads throughout the four heavens, and if it walks with its feet, the ground it touches becomes golden sand.

source_sentence: 紺馬寶者，身紺青色，其馬毛尾，皆悉珠色，皆雨七寶；若王乘上，一食之頃，遊四天下，不疲不勞。
translation: The purple horse treasure has a purple and blue body, and the hairs and tails of its horses are all the color of pearls, and they all rain seven treasures; if the king rides one, it travels throughout the four heavens in an instant of food without tiring or exerting itself.

source_sentence: 神珠寶者，自然而至，其珠光明，晝夜恒照百二十里，內復能雨於七寶，稱給一切。
translation: The precious jewel of the gods comes naturally, and its beads shine brightly for 120 miles day and night, and it rains seven treasures that are praiseworthy to all.

source_sentence: 玉女寶者，自然而至，端正殊妙，稱適王意。
translation: The jeweled female comes naturally, and she's beautiful and correct, suited to the king's desires.

source_sentence: 典藏臣者，王須七寶，隨意給足，終無乏盡。
translation: The treasurer of the store is a minister for the king who needs seven treasures to be supplied as he wishes, and there's never a lack of them.

source_sentence: 其典兵臣，王若欲須四種兵時，顧視之頃，諸兵悉集，行陣嚴整，威力非凡。
translation: His military attaché, when the king desires four kinds of troops, he looks at them and sees that they're all assembled, marching in formation in an orderly fashion with extraordinary power.

source_sentence: 七寶既具，坐自思惟：『吾享斯位，皆由前身宿種福業，乃致之耳，今當紹繼使不斷絕。』
translation: Once the seven treasures are complete, he sits down and thinks to himself, 'I've enjoyed this position because of the past meritorious actions of my predecessors, and now I will continue to promote it so that it won't end.'

source_sentence: 即以香湯，洗浴其身，著新淨衣，手執香爐，向于東方，跪而言曰：『東方快士，來受我請。』
translation: He then washed himself with scented bathing water, put on fresh, clean clothing, held a censer in his hand, knelt down in the east, and said, 'Come, pleasant man of the east, accept my invitation.'

source_sentence: 即時便有二萬辟支佛，來至王宮；南西北方，悉皆請之，時有六萬辟支佛，來受王請。
translation: Immediately, 20,000 pratyekabuddhas came to the king's palace; they were all invited from the south, west, and north, and there were 60,000 pratyekabuddhas who came to accept the king's invitation.

source_sentence: 王與諸臣，四事供養，其八萬四千諸小國王，離家來久，即啟大王，欲辭還國，王即聽之。
translation: The king and his ministers made four offerings, and 84,000 of those small kingdoms who had been away from home for a long time revealed to the king that they wanted to return to their countries, and the king listened to them.

source_sentence: 因啟王曰：『此中快士，其數甚眾，願王垂愍，減省少許，與臣供養，願使將來共享斯福。』
translation: He then instructed the king, 'There are so many of these happy people, may the king have mercy and reduce their number by a small amount and give them to his ministers for offerings, in the hope that they'll share this fortune in the future.'

source_sentence: 於時大王，即以四方辟支佛，與諸小王，隨時供養，經八萬四千歲。
translation: The great king then gave the four quarters of the pratyekabuddhas to the lesser kings to make offerings at any time for 84,000 years.

source_sentence: 諸王臣民，命終之後，皆得生天。」
translation: When their lives ended, all of the king's subjects were born in the heavens."

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「欲知爾時令奴王者，今現我父白淨王是。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "You want to know about the person who made King Slave at that time, now there's my father, King Baijian.

source_sentence: 爾時提婆跋提夫人者，今現我母摩訶摩耶是。
translation: At the time, Lady Devapati was my mother, Mahāmāyā.

source_sentence: 爾時提婆令奴王者，今我身是。
translation: At the time, that was King Deva-rāja, and now I am him.

source_sentence: 爾時五百太子者，今此五百釋是。
translation: At the time, these were the five hundred princes, and now these are the five hundred interpreters.

source_sentence: 我乃爾時，於諸人中，最為尊妙；吾今成佛，眾相具足，於此眾中，最為奇妙。」
translation: At the time, I was the most honored and wonderful of all people, and now that I've become a buddha, I have all the characteristics and am the most wonderful of them all."

source_sentence: 時諸大會，聞佛所說，有得須陀洹者、斯陀含、阿那含、阿羅漢者，有種辟支佛因緣者，有發菩薩心成不退者，眾坐歡喜，頂戴奉行。
translation: When the assembly heard what the Buddha taught, those who had attained stream entry, once-returner, non-returner, and arhat status, those who had developed the causes and conditions of a pratyekabuddha, and those who had arisen the bodhisattva intention to become irreversible rejoiced, sat down, paid homage, and handed it down.

source_sentence: （四四）善求惡求緣品第四十九
translation: (44) The Forty-ninth Chapter of Seeking Good and Seeking Evil Conditions

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時佛在舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時提婆達多，雖復出家，利養蔽心，作三逆罪，推山壓佛，傷佛脚指，復縱放黑象，欲令害佛，別僧兩部，殺漏盡比丘尼。
translation: At the time, Devadatta, though still a renunciant, was so sheltered by his desire for profit that he committed three heinous crimes, pushed a mountain against the Buddha, injured his toes, set loose a black elephant with the intention of harming the Buddha, separated the two sections of the saṃgha, and killed a monk and nun whose contaminants had been ended.

source_sentence: 以故殺生，疑畏受後報。
translation: As a result, they killed living beings and became suspicious and fearful of the consequences that would follow.

source_sentence: 時有六師，即往問之，六師便為說諸邪見，言：「為惡無罪，為善無福，信敬心生，喪斷善根。」
translation: Six masters then went to him and asked him about them, and they explained the mistaken views, saying, "Doing evil is no offense, doing good is no merit, and faith and respect arise, which deprives you of your good roots."

source_sentence: 是時阿難，析體愛重，惋恨情深，悲哽懊惱，白世尊言：「調達愚癡！
translation: Then Ānanda, overcome with physical affection and deep regret, was overcome with sorrow and anguish, and said to the Bhagavān, "It's foolish to tame foolishness!

source_sentence: 造不善業，壞破善根，辱釋種子。」
translation: They create unwholesome activity, destroy their good roots, and dishonor the seeds of Śākyamuni."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，告阿難言：「提婆達多，非但今世為利養故斷破善根，過去世時亦貪利養喪身失命。」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Ānanda, "Devadatta, not only did you cut off your good roots in this life for the sake of gain, but you also craved gain and lost your life in a past life."

source_sentence: 阿難白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 提婆達多，過去世時，貪利喪身，其事云何？
translation: Devadatta, in a past life, what happened when he craved gain and lost his life?

source_sentence: 願樂欲聞。」
translation: May I wish to hear about it."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「善聽當說！
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Listen well! You will tell it!

source_sentence: 往昔無量不可思議阿僧祇劫，此閻浮提，有國名波羅奈。
translation: A long time ago, in an incalculably long and unfathomable eon, there was a country in this Jambudvīpa named Vārāṇasī.

source_sentence: 時有薩薄名摩訶夜移，其婦懷妊，自然仁善，意性柔和。
translation: At the time, there was a sahāsa named Mahāyāna, whose pregnant woman was naturally kind and gentle of mind.

source_sentence: 月滿生男，形體端正，父母愛念，施設美饍，延請親戚并諸相師，共相娛樂，抱兒示眾，為其立字。
translation: When the moon was full, she gave birth to a boy with a perfectly proportioned body who was loved by his parents, who provided a delicious meal, invited relatives and other masters to entertain him, took him in their arms, and showed him to the crowd to name him.

source_sentence: 相師問言：『此兒受胎已來，有何瑞應？』
translation: The fortune teller asked, 'Since this child was conceived, what auspicious response has he had?'

source_sentence: 其父答言：『受胎已來，其婦自然，慈心和善。』
translation: His father answered, 'Since she was conceived, this woman has been naturally kind and good-natured.'

source_sentence: 相師即為立字，名為善求。
translation: The fortuneteller then created a word for her, which was called 'well sought after.'

source_sentence: 乳哺長大，好積諸德，慈愍眾生。
translation: He nursed her, grew up, accumulated good qualities, and was kind to sentient beings.

source_sentence: 次後懷妊，自然弊惡，期滿生男，形體醜陋。
translation: When she next became pregnant, she was naturally malnourished, and at the end of her pregnancy she gave birth to a boy who was ugly in appearance.

source_sentence: 即請相師，為其立字。
translation: He then asked his fortune teller to name him.

source_sentence: 相師問言：『此兒懷妊，有何感應？』
translation: The fortune teller asked, 'What's the vision of this child who's pregnant?'

source_sentence: 答言：『懷兒已來，受性弊惡。』
translation: He replied, 'Since he was conceived, he's had a bad and evil nature.'

source_sentence: 於時相師，即為立字，名曰惡求。
translation: The master then created a word for him, which was called 'evil intent.'

source_sentence: 乳哺長大，好為惡事，恒生貪心，懷嫉妬意。
translation: When he nurses his son, he grows up, likes to do bad things, is constantly greedy, and harbors jealousy.

source_sentence: 「年各長大，欲行共賈入海求索寶物，各有五百侍從，前後而發。
translation: "When they each grew older, they wanted to go into the ocean with a caravan to search for treasures, and they each had 500 attendants who went before and after them.

source_sentence: 途路懸遠，中道乏糧，經於七日，去死不遠。
translation: The journey was long and uncertain, and the middle path was short of provisions; after seven days, their journey to death wasn't far.

source_sentence: 是時善求，及諸賈人，咸共誠心，禱諸神祇，欲濟飢儉，於空澤中，遙見一樹枝葉欝茂，便即趣之。
translation: Shanqiu and the other rich men then joined their hearts and prayed to the gods to help them with their hunger and poverty.

source_sentence: 有一泉水，善求及眾，悉共誠心，求哀救護。
translation: There was a spring, and Shanqiu and the crowd all joined in sincerely asking for pity and protection.

source_sentence: 誠感神應，現身語之：『斫去一枝，所須當出。』
translation: They were truly answered by a spirit who showed up in person and said, 'Chop off a branch, and what's needed will come out.'

source_sentence: 諸人歡喜，便斫一枝，美飲流出。
translation: The people rejoiced, so they chopped off one branch, and delicious food and drink flowed out of it.

source_sentence: 斫第二枝，種種食出，百味具足，咸共承接，各得飽滿。
translation: Chopping off the second branch, various foods come out, complete with a hundred flavors, and they all share it, each attaining its own satisfaction.

source_sentence: 斫第三枝，出諸妙衣，種種備具。
translation: Chopping off the third branch, it produces marvelous clothing and various necessities.

source_sentence: 斫第四枝，種種寶物，悉皆具足，莊嚴悉備，所須盡辦。
translation: Chopping down the fourth branch, they are supplied with all kinds of treasures, adorned in every way, and supplied with everything that's needed.

source_sentence: 惡求後到，眾人如前，盡得充足，便自念言：『今此樹枝，能出如是種種好物，況復其根？
translation: When the crowd arrived after the evil request, they were all supplied as before, and then they thought to themselves, 'Now, this branch of the tree can produce such a variety of good things, so why wouldn't it be possible for its roots to do so?'

source_sentence: 今當伐之，足得極妙佳好之物。』
translation: Now, you will cut it down, and it will be enough to obtain something really wonderful and good.'

source_sentence: 思惟心定，令人伐之。
translation: He concentrated his thoughts and asked them to cut it down.

source_sentence: 是時善求，聞如是語，懷憤懊惱，語惡求言：『我等飢乏，命在旦夕，蒙此樹恩，得濟餘命。
translation: When Shanqiu heard those words, he was anguished and distressed, and he said to Niangqiu, 'We're starving and our lives are on the brink, and thanks to this tree's kindness, we'll be able to save the rest of our lives.

source_sentence: 云何懷此弊惡之心，而欲伐之？』
translation: Why do you want to cut it down with such a bad intention?'

source_sentence: 爾時惡求，不用其言，即掘其根。
translation: At the time, he didn't need to be told, but he dug up his roots.

source_sentence: 善求感佩，不忍見之，領眾歸家。
translation: Being impressed, Shanqiu couldn't bear to see him, so he led the crowd back home.

source_sentence: 伐樹已竟，有五百羅剎，取此惡求及眾賈人，悉皆噉之，財物伴侶，一切喪失。」
translation: After they finished cutting down the tree, five hundred rājas took this Nāgasena and the other merchants and devoured them, losing all their possessions and companions."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「爾時善求者，今我身是。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "At the time, that was the good seeker, and now I am it.

source_sentence: 爾時父者，今現我父淨飯王是。
translation: At the time, my father was, and now I'm the father of the Pure Land King.

source_sentence: 爾時母者，今現我母摩訶摩耶是也。
translation: At the time, this was my mother, and now this is my mother Mahāmāyā.

source_sentence: 時惡求者，今提婆達多是。
translation: For those times when I sought badly, this is now Devadatta.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 提婆達多，非但今日作不善事，貪利養故，世世常造。
translation: Devadatta, not only are you doing unskillful things today, but you've always done them from generation to generation because of your desire for profit.

source_sentence: 我於往昔，常與相值，恒教善法，而不用之，反更以我為怨。」
translation: In the past, I've always met with them and taught them the good Dharma, but I didn't use them; instead, I made them resent me."

source_sentence: 爾時阿難，及四部眾，聞佛所說，悲喜交集，咸自勸勵，頂戴奉行。
translation: It was then that Ānanda and the four groups of people who heard what the Buddha taught were united in sorrow and joy, and they all encouraged themselves to bow down and approve.
